citation.article-title: Silvimonas iriomotensis sp. nov. and Silvimonas amylolytica sp. nov., new members of the class Betaproteobacteria isolated from the subtropical zone in Japan
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of the genus Silvimonas Yang et al. 2005
Silvimonas (Sil.vi.mo′nas. L. fem. n. silva forest; L. fem. n. monas a unit, monad; N.L. fem. n. Silvimonas forest monad).
The emended description is based on data from Yang et al. (2005) and this study.
Cells are Gram-negative, rod-shaped (0.8–2.0 μm by 0.3–0.8 μm) and facultatively anaerobic.
They occur singly or in pairs and are motile by means of a single polar flagellum.
Colonies on R2A are circular, convex and milky white.
Catalase is positive or weakly positive.
Major cellular fatty acids are C16 : 0, C16 : 1ω7c and C18 : 1ω7c when strains are cultivated on LB medium at 30 °C for 24 h.
Some strains additionally contain C17 : 0 cyclo as a major fatty acid.
The G+C content of the genomic DNA is 57–60 mol%.
The type species is Silvimonas terrae.
